definition: to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: When the markets opened the following Monday, the Dow bid adieu to 10000 for good.
sentences.chinese: 股市在紧接着的周一开盘时就告别了10000点。

sentences.english: Then, several motorcycle march off, leaving the engine sound.
sentences.chinese: 接着，几台摩托车扬长而去，留下阵阵的引擎声。

sentences.english: And look a little further down in the same paragraph.
Then, with the moon sister Xiaotu to its home.
sentences.chinese: 接着，月亮姐姐带着小兔来到了它的家。

sentences.english: And now click on the two branches to give the snowman arms.
sentences.chinese: 接着现在按一下这两个树杈给雪人臂膀。

sentences.english: Do whatever you can today, then continue on tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 今天，只管做你能做的，接着明天继续。

sentences.english: So then I wondered, who is the ad targeting, who is the buyer?
sentences.chinese: 接着我又想，这则广告的对象是什么人，买主是谁？

sentences.english: Then adaptive NNs (Neural Networks) are introduced for their structure and approximation ability.
sentences.chinese: 接着对自适应神经网络及其逼近特性加以介绍。

sentences.english: Then I have patted "the Day Yunshan Legend" with him.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着，我又跟他拍了《天云山传奇》。

sentences.english: “In Stars Wars, the Death Star died twice, ” Willard continued.
sentences.chinese: 他接着说在《星球大战》中，死亡之星死了两次。

sentences.english: It's the first thing they should teach you after arithmetic, in grade school.
sentences.chinese: 这是你在学校学完基本算术后的紧接着的课。

sentences.english: After the war came the problem of rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 大战以后接着而来的是重建问题。

sentences.english: Then he saw one on the surface swimming in circles.
sentences.chinese: 接着他看见其中的一条在海面上绕着圈儿游着。

sentences.english: So Mary stood in the circle and then something strange happened.1
sentences.chinese: 于是玛丽站在了蘑菇圈里，接着奇怪的事发生了。

sentences.english: Later she went to work for China Central Television Station, presenting two variety shows.
sentences.chinese: 接着她又在中央电视台工作，主持两档综艺节目。

definition: a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
(used after a verb) give it a go/to do (sth for a bit to give it a try)/one time/once/in a while/all of a sudden/all at once
to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
